title: badly maintained
review: The taal is the worst maintained amongst all the lakes. Looks like an artifical lake and without any care and maintenance. Tourism department needs to develop this place urgently

title: Lake with bad maintenance
review: This lake you have been seen on the way to going Ramnagar.It is small lake and not to do any maintenance activity.

title: don't go now nothing is there
review: small pond which can become better when it will get clean. They started but it will take good time to clean may be 6-8 months. If you going waterfall khurpatal this place will come in between

title: Don't forget to Enjoy Maggi at Pundit Ji Maggi
review: Small Tal, Near mountains, peaceful you can have some photos here, Butter Maggi at Pundit ji Maggi Point is really testy so enjoy it

title: so so
review: after seeing nainital and bhimtall, all other tals look so-so. nothing spectacular. only speciality is that saria tal is artificially created.

title: OK
review: just a very small lake now trying to save it with artificial constructions ... few km from nainital.. though add to the beauty of the way

title: just another lake
review: Just a lake on the way to Nainital. Not very clean. There is nothing to see at this place. Can be avoided....

title: sheer waste
review: its a small man made lake a lil ahead of nainital...its counted amongst one of the tourist spots and is nothing but a sheer waste....when i went there, it was all dried up and covered with mosses....not at all a space to spend any time at.

title: Small water body on the way to nainital
review: This is a small lake on the way to nainital... Not recommended for boating... But,  a great place to hop over while visiting nainital

title: A scenic chai maggie break between nainital and kaladhungi
review: This place has an man-made lake with a step waterfall in a corner and it lies on the main road from kaladhungi to nainital. Lake is clean and full in September end. One may stop at the side of road and enjoy tea and snacks by the lake side. Although a dedicated trip from nainital will not be a good idea.

title: Man made lake not much interesting
review: Not much interesting but good for killing time. Dont seek for an adventure there except the roads. well not a point to miss if you are an casual tourist and went to explore nainital.

title: can be easily spotted on the right side of the kaladhungi nainital road
review: can be easily spotted on the right side of the kaladhungi nainital road if you are driving towards Nainital. has a small Maggie point . boating facility is available,

title: One of the many lakes in Nainital
review: Came across this lake on our way back from Nainital.

title: Little lake
review: This lake is on the Nainital- Kaladungi route. Easily accessible from the road head, this is a very small water pool. If you are driving up or down between Nainital and Kaladungi/ Ramnagar; a brief stop would suffice. We were here on a day closer to the day it snowed in downtown Nainital, but this place was not all that cold.

title: small nice lake
review: This lake is quite small, and locals call them younger brother of Nainital lake.It comes on the way to Kaladungi.

title: Small lake
review: It seems that the lake is man-made; anyways its a good break to stop over on way to Nainital. Good for taking pictures.

title: Another small lake in Nainital
review: One of the many small lakes in Nainital is this place to sit and relax in quiet atmosphere. You can find it on your way to Nainital, no special visit required.

title: Man made lake
review: 5 kms. from nainital towards kaladungi this spot offer nothing to talk about. It is just a pond not a lake. Avoid if you plan to visit in anticipation to see some large lake.

title: Another lake in between Nainital way to Uttaranchal Restaurant
review: Its 50meter distance from Uttaranchal Restaurant, Waterfall, Nainital, having good water for watersports and ideal for spent time in lust of nature.

title: Small lake with paddle boats
review: It is a small lake with paddle boats falling enroute to Nainital from Kaladhungi side. It was a comfortable place to be there for some time.

title: Good Place
review: Saria Tal is a small lake with boating facility. View of the place is excellent and near by park is one good place for the kids. You will fine few good dhabas near the place to eat.

title: Wonderful cascade
review: Wonderful cascade on-route Khurpatal. Have 2-3 different levels, awesome for taking selfies. You can also have good food there.

title: Good place but not compare to other lake
review: The lake is beautiful but its small compare other lakes. You can feel peace there and view is good as other lakes.

title: Total disappointment
review: Dont waste your time going all the way there. It is just a very small lake with no great scenery and absolutely nothing to do there. There is just a tiny shack selling tea n few other  food items. All in all a total disappointment.

title: Small lake
review: It is a very small lake and has a small tea shack and few branches. It is very quite and only suitable for honeymooners

title: Tiny lake on the way
review: This Tal is a very small lake (looks like a man-made one) and it falls on the way to Nainital if you are going by the Kaladhungi road. Nice for a quick visit.

title: An ordinary lake
review: Ordinary man made lake, nothing extraordinary, no harm skipping it.

title: bit untidy but very quiet
review: Lovely spot, seemed a bit run down to me. As it was so quiet there were quite a few birds near the water eg Kingfishers

title: small lake
review: Another smallish lake en route to Nainital. Some tea stalls. One can stop and explore. Nothing important

title: Small But Beautiful Lake
review: Saria Tal is a small but alluring lake located at a distance of around 5 kilometers from Nainital.This is almost a heart-shaped lake.You can spend sometime in solitude here basking in the absolute beauty of nature.

title: Another lake  ...
review: We took the lake tour, and visited many lakes.  One thing that we learnt, Tally tal, and Mally tal .. simply means, lower altitude, and higher altitude.  Tal, in other words used for a lake .....

title: Another lake round the corner!!!
review: Saria Tal is about 5 kms away from Nainital on the way to Kaladhungi, nestled this small Lake and a beautiful tourist spot. Saria Tal is a very good place to pass some time in solitude enjoying the beauty of nature.The maximum you can do is take a picture in front of the lake and resume your journey.

title: Nice Place
review: Sariyatal is about 5 kms away from Nainital on the way to Kaladhungi, nestled this small Lake and a beautiful tourist spot.

title: its more a maggie point or a break point
review: good to see people taking a break and eating maggie  just ok to stop if you have time otherwise can be seen from your car also

title: good view of the falls
review: Sarai Tal is a small lake.but it had boating facilities. and A small children's park. And there is a restaurant near lake.

title: The name says it ALL..
review: After viewing all the lakes in the vicinity here in Nianital, I visited Saria Tal, situated 9-10 kms from the mall road, this place is counted in the local sightseeing trip. But the view from the front is dull and looks like a man made lake as compared to nainital/ Saat taal/Bhim Taal which are natural lakes and offer great view. There is a man made waterfalls beneath the lake where the water is let out for being supplied to the locals.

title: A small lake on the way to Ramnagar
review: This is a small lake which you encounter on the return from Nainital to Kala dunghi.  It is quite small compared to the Naini lake.

title: good sight seeing destination
review: A really good destination for sight seeing and getting out of a big city. Good views while the drive to the point and near the lake

title: saria tal
review: saria tal is small lake in the way of nainital in short it is a small tourist attraction pleople love to sit near lake and have small water fall also there so alot people is click photos over there.

title: Not amazing lake as compared to others
review: this lake is good. view near this lake is good. but its not that much good as compared to naina lake and bhimtal. there is small garden for children. there is good photography spot nothing else. if u skip this then its ok.

title: Average Lake
review: On the way to khurpatal on Nainital Corbett road,visit Sariyataland water fall which is man made and developed as picnic spot and paddle boating,its nice place to spend some time with family & friends there are few tea stalls and fast food center.

title: nothing great just ok,a small man made water falls with Rs5 ticket is good for short stay
review: The place is around 5-6 kms from mall road and have a small lake,it is less crowded and have a small water fall.the kids like this place.

title: Beautiful Place
review: Sariyatal is about 5 kms away from Nainital on the way to Kaladhungi, nestled this small Lake and a beautiful tourist spot.

title: it is ok to visit
review: this is one lake out of 9 or 10 lakes in nainital.there is nothing exiting to see any thing. if you get the tour plan from any tour operator then it is ok else you can avoid it

title: Alright
review: This is the smallest of all lakes around Nainital. There is one waterfall around which doesn't have much water in summer

title: SMALL LAKE
review: It is a small lake.... had boating facilities .... and a small children's park. And a restaurant. A short drive up gets you to the waterfalls .... which are rightfully called a "cascade"! Slippery rocks .... as seen in the picture

title: small tal, very quite
review: small tall very quite. which does look like man made.. which give u scene like a swimming pool. nothing much here except just stay for 5 min and stand on railing to observe peace..or kids can enjoy boating and eating.

title: good place..calme and serene...
review: visited the tal and also the falls. easily accessible on the road and can have a good view of the falls and can take snaps...

title: just so so
review: Basically it is a man made small pond. The water is used for irrigation through canal by Irrigation Deptt, Govt Of Uttrakhand. This is situated on Kaladhungi-Nainital road. En route to Nainital , one may spend some time sipping tea along the Tal and move to Nainital.

title: Pit stop for kids
review: Quaint little spot for kids and a small boat ride . The original lake has been dammed  to permit water all the year around . One can stop on the way from Kaladungi .

title: Worth for a few photographs!
review: I have been here while on the way back to Delhi from Nainital.Good to stop by and for a few pics. I wouldnt recommend someone to specifically plan for this Tal...but its a good stopover.

title: On going attraction
review: A taal made for irrigation. just on the way attraction. not worth to spend much time. on the way to khurpataal

title: Lake
review: Its a lake that was previously used to dispose city waste. The lake has now been converted into a tourist attraction.

title: Nice lake
review: The Sadia Taal is a small but nice lake about an hours drive from Nainital. One should visit this place only if he/she has time.There is also a waterfall nearby.

title: nothing much to see
review: nainital is a city of lake.there are plenty of beautiful natural lakes.no need for any artificial lake like saria tal.maximum u can do is take a picture in front of the lake n resume your journey.

title: Just ok..
review: Nothing much to see or do here.. there is a waterfall nearby which isnt really great.. so you could give this place a miss.

title: Just a Local Sight Scene Point on Local Tours Map
review: No fun stopping here. Many better things to see in Nainital. It was raining light when we reached here. Did not get down here. Lake water becomes muddy when rained.

title: Good waterfalls
review: We went to this place in a rainy season.Flls was good and amazing.Roads are good and some eateries out side.Lot of geenary and it is worth visiting on a trip to nainital
